moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 Bf5 3. Nc3: a strong reply which is not easy to meet.  3 ... c6 may be the best intending to meet 4 Qb3 with Qd7.
moves.4... Bd7 5. Bxc4 e6 6. Nf3 Bb4 7. O-O: 7 ... c5 seems like a natural approach here.  black's king looks like it will be vulnerable after 7 ... Ne7 and 0-0
moves.7... Bc6 8. Qe2 Nf6: black was sleeping here.  d5 was the threat which he missed.
moves.11... Qe7 12. e5: 12 ... Ng8 was probably a safer alternative though white stands well.
moves.12... Ng4 13. h3 Nh6 14. Bxh6 gxh6 15. N: a good example of allowing a combination a master wouldn't mention in his notes to the game.
moves.16. Nf6+ Kf7 17. Rxd7 Qxd7 18. Nxd7 Rad8: a little surprising that black resigned here but he clearly knows when to call it a day and rack them up again for the next battle.
